subject: Programming
title: Sets and Uniqueness
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sets and Uniqueness usable.

hook.text: A set stores unique elements only. Add a duplicate and it quietly ignores it.

buildup.text: Sets use hash tables internally, so checking membership is O(1) â€” instant yes or no.

discovery.text: Union, intersection, and difference operations on sets solve problems that loops make messy.

twist.text: Sets don't preserve order. If you need both uniqueness and order, you need a different structure.

climax.text: Deduplication, permission checks, and tag systems all use sets to enforce uniqueness efficiently.

punchline.text: No duplicates allowed. Membership is instant.

quiz.question: What makes checking set membership fast?
options: Sets store elements in a tree
